question: Each problem consists of three statements. Based on the first two statements, the third statement may be true, false, or uncertain. Four people witnessed a mugging. Each gave a different description of the mugger. Which description is probably right?
options: He was average height, thin, and middle-aged.
He was tall, thin, and middle-aged
He was tall, thin, and young.
He was tall, of average weight, and middle-aged.
correct_answer: He was tall, thin, and middle-aged.
